1Ô∏è‚É£  Use price increases strategically.

https://t.co/1LrFWABFig

2Ô∏è‚É£  Aim for cost visibility and transparency.

Analytics provide visibility into costs üí∞ and support real-time decisions about how people work üíº, how the end-to-end supply chain is flowing, and, critically, about areas of future growth. üìà That is top of mind for CEOs today.

3Ô∏è‚É£  Reset the baseline.

Over the past 18 months, companies have faced major disruption including supply chain issues üì¶, halting production and shifting to a remote workforce üíª.

It‚Äôs important to recognize that when the operating model changes, so must the baseline.

4Ô∏è‚É£  Make the cost structure more variable.

The focus should be on agility and flexibility for the future. Zero-based cost transformation offers multiple options for increased flexibility, with the entire operating model presenting opportunities for re-thinking costs. üí≠

5Ô∏è‚É£  Build operating resilience.

Cost transformation aligns the enterprise operating model with future strategy. It extends into go-to-market strategies, customer service and company culture. But it also improves preparedness and the ability to bounce back from adverse events.
